intro: Tetraena smithii, commonly known as the Smith's tetraena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and desert landscapes. Tetraena smithii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
